50963.description:
"Auf den Inseln" ("On the islands") is the first exclusive German Cthulhu campaign. It contains three scenarios plus a vast amount of background information on the german north sea coastal areas covered by these scenarios, especially the islands Borkum and Sylt.

From publishers website (translated):

Product info: Besides the voluminous campaign book "Auf den Inseln" contains several full-colour historical maps, e. g. maps of the islands Borkum and Sylt plus an general map of the whole german north sea area. Also included in the box are booklet with frisian myths and legends, which can be utilized in the campaign and are specially fitted for the scenarios, and a reproduction of a 1920s tourist guide for Borkum island. For the gamemaster's use there's every handout used in the scenarios included separately and in colour.

50964.name: Parlor Games
50964.description:
From the publisher's website:

There are things in this world that come from somewhere else. Hungry things. They scrabble in the dark places, reaching out to draw in prey. Sometimes it’s human prey. Sometimes it’s the People.

One of those things is reaching out even further now. It’s built its nest somewhere unreachable. It’s subtle and cunning, enough so to hide its own strength. And it is strong, and it is dangerous. But it made a mistake. It began to hunt on your territory. It started to take people that are under your protection.

Now it’s time for you to do the hunting.

50965.name: Festival Obscure
50965.description:
German Cthulhu publication containing three scenarios and background information revolving around the world of carnivales, the travelling people and gypsies in the 1920s.

From the publishers website (translated):
The glamorous and entertaining, but nevertheless unfamiliar world of freak shows and monstrosities, amusement rides and magicians is brought to life with this hardcover.

Besides source information on folk festival in the 1920s and an insight in the every day's life of the carnies on finds here an extensive description of a sample typical carnivale for use as a generic adventure location with many attractions and ready-to-play NPCs. Contains three scenarios.

"A matter of perspective" concerns the players during a stay in the city of Gdansk. They are entangled into several strange incidents: A body is found, traces lead to the local carnivale where there's more than just one curiosity.

"The double Lottie" not only get's the players a free visit to a circus, but also some kind of fright. In a nerve-wracking confusion there's quite a whole queue of suspects in the case presenting to them.

"The Man Who Laughs" invites for a very special festival on the carnival. Who's not yet afraid of clowns already might be after this adventure...

50966.name: Lorien Trust Guide To Rituals 2002
50966.description:
User Summary: The magic system in the Lorien Trust Role-Playing game allows characters to cast instant spells or short rites fuelled by their individual power. But the possible effects that they can perform are limited by the spell lists that they have access to, and by the amount of power that they individually wield. Rituals are a more powerful type of magic that are not as limited in range and application.

Rituals are performed in a ritual circle: a special area that in character is a nexus of magical forces, and out of character is rigged with light, sound, and special effects systems. There is one circle at each of the large LT events run by Merlinroute Ltd, but not at any of the smaller events. Ritualists must book a slot in the circle in advance.

A ritual is led by one ritualist, and typically supported by a ritual team. Together they perform for ten to twenty minutes, and are then marked on their efforts. Scores are given for both entertainment value and for relevance to the effect that they are trying to produce. A combination of this score and the amount of power that the ritual team have brought to the circle determine how effective the ritual is.

This guide was written for the second edition of Lorien Trust Role-Playing, to provide more detail on how to perform rituals. The core rulebook doesn't cover this topic at all, only giving the rules needed to allow a player to decide at character creation whether they can perform or support rituals. This rulebook is sufficiently generic that it is still valid for the third edition of the game system, and has not been superseded.

The guide introduces the concept of rituals, and gives tips on how to perform them well. The rules are given from a player's point of view, so that they know what they generally need to do to succeed, but the underlying mechanics of exactly how the ritual score and power level determine the ritual effects are not disclosed. Thus experienced players that have performed many rituals are more likely to have a good idea of how to perform a successful ritual.

There is also an example ritual in the guide, in the form of a complete script. This gives players a much better idea of how they work in practice, and a useful idea of what is realistic.

50967.name: Expeditionen: Ins Herz der Finsternis
50967.description:
"Expeditions - Into the Heart of Darkness"
A german scenario book for the Cthulhu RPG revolving around expeditions the dangerous and rather unknowns spots in the world in the 1920s, with additional source/background informations.

From the publishers website (translated):
(...) contains five scenarios leading the adventurers beyond the frontiers of civilization into regions of the exotic, undiscovered and most of all: horror...

An introducing essay supports players and gamemaster in the planning of expedition scenarios and depicts what man really depends on in the middle of nowhere, and does this not by extensive equipment lists, encounter charts and travel speed calculations.

"The Heart of Darkness" beats in the Belgian Congo. To there the adventurers depart in this scenario to capture on legend of cryptozoology - the Mokele Mbembe. Trying to get on the trail of this dinosaur-like creature, the journeys leads them deeper into the river labyrinths of the Congo, into a undiscovered and wild region housing more horrors than the dinohunters would ever like to meet.

"Eternal Ice" rules the polar regions of the world, but between the enormouse galciers of greenlands outbacks the adventurer soon realize, that not all of this ice if from this world, and that the search for a long lost airship expedition is not the only reason for their own mission...

"The Lost City" in the Andes has only recently been discovered, when a team of explorers already disappears in it without a trace. Will the adventurers uncover the secret of the ruins, or will they too become prey of an eons-old terror?

"Curso Cannibale" sends the adventurers on the hunt for a multi-million heir into the green hell of the Amazonas. There they not only have to prove in a murderous racing duel, but will also realize that in the tropical brush the hunters soon become the hunted...

"The Final Rest of the Minna B." is surrounded by mysteries: The freighter disappeared of the norwegian coast. To investigate the circumstances the adventurers are sent there, where few days later a lone survivor appears: a tribal village in the mountains of Papua New Guinea...

50968.name: Gary Gygax's Living Fantasy
50968.description:
From the back of the book:

For the vigilant gamer or driven world builder, Living Fantasy drives forward the host of information in the Gygaxian Fantasy Worlds series. Setting designers who master the knowledge within this tome shall breathe magic into their creation. From vagabond to king, Living Fantasy details the everyday life of those who inhabit the towns, cities, and castles in a fantasy world, and contains supplementary rules for the d20 System and the Lejendary Adventure system.

50969.name: Pesispeli
50969.description:
Pesispeli is about the Finnish national sport of pesäpallo, a sport somewhat similar to baseball. The game was developed by Pasin Pelit in the early 1990s.

The game can be played with dice only, or a combination of dice and nine action cards. The action depends upon the roll of the die (action 1-6) as well as the cards are situation-specific, e.g. if you're batting you use one card, or if you're between first and second base you used another card to decide what happens. The objective of the game is be the first to get five runs, a run completed by going through the 53 points on the board.

Components:
1 board depicting a playing field
1 die
4 playing figures
9 cards

50970.name: Geisterschiffe
50970.description:
"Ghost Ships" is a german publication for the Cthulhu RPG published by Pegasus Spiele, containing five scenarios and source/background information on the topic "ghost ships".

From the publisher's website (translated):
"Ghost Ships" tells from the legends of the sea and the secrets of the Cthulhu mythos hidden in the dark oceans...

This hardcover contains a background chapter and five scenarios.

Background
Legends of ghost ships and the Cthulhu-Mythos - ideas and informations for scenarios on and at the sea. Source information for all eras.

"Heavy wax"
A death and a strange substance lead the adventurers to the port of Hamburg and on the trail of a secret submarine project. This escalates in unexpected ways and soon they are in the proverbial trap...
An investigative scenario in the 1920s with connections to the "Auf den Inseln"-campain.

"A Ship Will Come"
A long sunken sailing ship lures strange people on the island of Neuwerk, and all of a sudden the adventurers are between all fronts. The wreck in the tideland seems to hide a secret that interests a many folks - and an especially deadly it is too...
A haunting scenario at the Elbe river delta for the 1920s era.

"The Bust of Lady Grey"
With an old sailing ship the adventurers are abound to transport a valuable antiquity from New York to England. But there seems to be a curse upon this item, as on the journey back horrible things happen aboard. A horror stalks the Christabel...
A scenario on the high seas for the 1890s and 1920s.

"Death aboard"
The voyage on the luxury passenger steamer Charon takes a strange course after passing a scary ghost ship. The adventurers have to part illusion from reality to solve the mystery - but do they really want to solve it or isn't the truth just to horrible?
An atmospheric mystery thriller in the 1920s.

"Blazing Fire"
A firebug scares the skippers at the harbor of Duisburg-Ruhrort. The adventurers investigate traces to the past, but for one family all their help is already too late. A horrible demon awakes...
A scenario in the inland sailor's milieu in the 1920s.

50971.name: Plüsch, Power & Plunder (2nd Edition)
50971.description:
2nd edition of the games rules. From the back of the book (translated):

Didn't you too always believe stuffed animals are only there act as hugging buddies for mankind? Boy have you ever been wrong! They live! And even better: You can take part in the action when the wool starts to pulse sindie Barney Bear and Mr. Thumpy.
See the world with button eyes and enter the thrilling world of Plush, Power and Plunder! The new rules allow an even more turbulent game and are accompanied by a whole set of playing aids for starters and veterans. The scenario included guarantees fun and excitement from the beginning!

50972.name: The Harvesters
50972.description:
From the publisher's website:

People Disappear All The Time. Will You Be One Of Them? In The Harvesters, the characters are pitted against a group of kidnappers that prey upon the forgotten people and sell them off to the highest bidder. They visit upon those lost souls any torment that pleases them, so long as they don’t compromise the bottom line. But all isn’t as it seems, and what at first appears to be a perfectly normal (if genuinely monstrous) crime begins to show the involvement of something unnatural around the edges, revealing to the characters a glimpse of the strange and terrifying things that lurk in the shadows.

A story in the Storytelling Adventure System for the World of Darkness, inspired by Midnight Roads. The Harvesters contains a number of interactive links that take you to page reference, reference sheets and even props that you can use at the gaming table.

50973.name: Zeitlose Ängste
50973.description:
"Zeitlose Ängste"("Ageless Fears") is a publication in the series "Cthuloide Welten Bibliothek", which is an offspring of the german "Cthuloide Welten" magazine published by Pegasus Spiele, containing four scenarios in different settings.

From the publishers website (translated):
"Daoloths first veil"
All starts with the heritage of a strange metal disc, upon which soon strange things start to happen, like cars becoming invisible and hard matter penetrable.
Is this connected to the heritage, or probably to a congress of physicists taking place in the city?
A scenario in the 1920s by Peter Schott.

"Last Men Standing"
The players are mobsters in the 1930s in the US. After a bank robbery gone sorta wrong they flee into the desert and hide in small town called Heaven's Gate. But this name is deceiving, not everything here is what it is supposed to be.
A thrilling crime story by Ingo Ahrens.

"Rotten by the wind"
The adventurers are B-movie actors from 1950s hollywood. When one of them is x-rayed after an accident it turns out that there are occult symbols engraved in his bones...
A haunting scenario by Peer Kröger.

"Cold War"
Toronto, Canada, in the present. The characters are members of an Ithaqua-cult, whose leader is found murdered. A rivaling cult, the police and several other obstacles hinder their investigation of the death. Soon they also realize, that each cultists follows his own secret agenda...
A Cthulhu-Now-scenario with much room for roleplaying and intrigue by Scott Aniolowski.

50974.name: Pirates of the Vistula
50974.description:
From back cover:

The mighty Vistula River sets the stage for a journey from Krakow to the remains of Warsaw aboard the river tug Wisla Krolowa.

All the important forces along the river, such as the bandit and marauder units, and of course, the vicious river pirates ... are described in terms of organization, equipment, and motivations.

Provides complete rules for a new type of warfare in the world of Twilight: 2000 -- riverine combat.

Pirates of the Vistula gives a rich detailed look at the entire course of the upper Vistula and its environs.

Includes deck plans of the Wisla Krolowa and map of the Vistula.

50975.name: Hinter den Schleiern
50975.description:
"Hinter den Schleiern" ("Beyond the Veils") is a publication in the series "Cthuloide Welten Bibliothek" which is an offspring of the german "Cthuloide Welten" magazine by Pegasus Spiele, containing four scenarios in different settings for the Cthulhu RPG.

From the publishers website (translated):
"Beyond the Veils" contains a background part "Cthulhu 1200 AD" as an expansion to "Cthulhu 1000 AD" plus four scenarios for different eras and settings.

Cthulhu 1200 AD - Baphomet's Circle
The investigators search the sieged city of Constantinople in the Middle Ages for the Al Azif, the original Necronomicon, threatend by fanatic templar knights and others.

Cthulhu WildWest, 1890s, 1920s - The Golden Scorpion
An ancient treasure map shows the way to a long forgotten aztec temple, where not only the Golden Scorpion, and invaluable treasure, is supposed to be found, but where also the life of the investigators will change radically.

Cathulhu - The Trail of the Black Cats
More and more cats are getting murdered in Arkham, and the killer appears to be a horrible beast. The furry characters start to investigate this mysterious case.

Cthulhu Now - Project Pi
As hardened Navy SEALs the characters explore a ghost ship, discover the horrible truth about the fate of the crew and even enter sunken R'lyeh itself. Cthulhu fhtagn!

50976.name: The Ruins of Warsaw
50976.description:
Warsaw was levelled by six NATO nuclear devices in 1997. The city, even in its current state, provided some protection against the bandits who ruled the countryside. Baron Czarny moved into the city, taking as his own the former Palace of Culture and Sciences. From this new Twierdza Czarny (black fortress) the evil Baron commands his horde to pillage and subjugate everyone in and around the city.

The player characters have become involved in the battle for Warsaw, between the baron and the Milicya. They will play leading roles -- commanding troops, ambushing convoys, contacting other communities, and trying to survive in the rubble and debris of Warsaw.

Also are complete macro combat rules for Twilight: 2000. Now battles involving hundreds of men and vehicles may be resolved quickly, easily, and realistically.

Includes map of Warsaw and Twilight Miniatures Rules: Draft edition (also published as a supplement to Challenge issue 25)

50981.name: The Black Madonna
rpgissuearticle: A Few Great Modules to Play
50981.description:
From the back cover:

The Black Madonna is an adventure module for Twilight: 2000. Silesia, in southern Poland, is the backdrop for a quest for a religious icon of great value. Was the icon taken east by the Soviets? Was it hidden in a cave by Polish patriots? Was it destroyed when Czestochowa was bombed? Did the NATO forces who occupied the city briefly carry it west with them? Or, does it rest beneath the ruins of Czestochowa? There is only one way to know for sure...

Over and above the main adventure, this module provides a picture of life in southwest Poland after the destruction of the war. The surviving cities, the resources, the petty lordlings and the major powers are given life and detail. From the court of the Markgraf of Silesia to the camps of the bandit gangs; from the ruined factories of Czestochowa and Gliwice to the slowly recovering facilities of Raciborz and Rybnik; all are described in rich detail.

This module provides a picture of life in southwest Poland after the destruction of the war. The surviving cities, the resources, the petty lordlings and the major powers are given life and detail.

Players are also given the chance to aid in finding the Black Madonna, a religious and cultural artifact that could help Poland rise from the ashes of the war.

50983.name: Occupational Skills (Second Edition)
50983.description:
Subtitle: A Guide to Advancement

User Summary: The basic rules of character creation in the Lorien Trust Role-Playing system give each player a fixed number of points to spend on Character Skills (CS) that allow their character to perform various actions. But the amount of CS is fixed so that no individual character can do everything (this encourages player co-operation). In order to provide a mechanism for character development, there are an additional set of abilities called Occupational Skills (OS).

For each event that a player attends, they are awarded a number of Occupational Skill Points (OSPs). The large events run by Merlinroute Ltd themselves give more OSPs (up to 10 per event) compared to the smaller weekend events run by other groups (1 OSP per event) to encourage players to spend their money directly with Merlinroute Ltd. OSPs can then be spent in order to buy OS.

Each OS has a minimum rank that a character must have in order to learn the skill, and a cost of 10 or more OSPs. The cost varies depending on whether the skill is learnt through a Guild (cheapest), Faction, or self-taught (most expensive). Additionally the higher level OS can only be learnt through Guilds (or just through Guilds and Factions), and some have further restrictions. Some OS form skill ladders, where you must learn a skills in turn. There are additional restrictions (such as a maximum of 12 OS per character) intended to prevent very old characters from unbalancing the system.

The range of abilities that OS can offer varies widely. Typical examples include (but are not limited to):

Enhancements to the character's damage calls with certain weapons.
Making worn armour more effective.
Granting immunity to particular spells or effects.
Giving access to additional spell lists.
Giving the character more power cards enabling them to cast more spells.
Additional loresheets that provide specialist information exclusive to those characters with that OS.
Crafting skills that allow characters to create a limited number of items with additional powers.




So these generally provide some degree of advantage for experienced players (that is, repeat customers) without unbalancing the game completely. A starting character can still gain a comparative advantage over an experienced character in particular fields through selecting different CS.

rpgitemversion: Rogue Trader Core Rulebook Collector's Edition
50985.name: Rogue Trader Core Rulebook
rpghonor: 2010 ENnies - Best Art, Cover - Nominee
2010 ENnies - Best Art, Interior - Nominee
2010 ENnies - Best Production Values - Nominee
2013 Gioco di Ruolo dell'Anno Winner
2013 Gioco di Ruolo dell’Anno Nominee
50985.description:
From the Publishers website:

In Rogue Trader, you take on the role of a Rogue Trader and his most trusted counsellors, empowered by an ancient warrant of trade to seek out profit and plunder amongst unexplored regions of space. Your ship will take you to new worlds and uncharted reaches of the void, where you will encounter rivals, pirates, aliens, and possibly even creatures of the warp. You will acquire and spend great wealth and riches, and fame or infamy will follow. You will discover ancient and forgotten mysteries and search out the unknown to find lost human worlds or never before seen celestial phenomena. You must survive the dangers of space, for beyond the threat of vacuum and deadly radiation lurk things Man was never meant to find.

To be part of a Rogue Trader’s crew is to stand on the threshold of nearly unlimited opportunity. Vast profits await for you and your fellow Explorers to find and claim. Fame and fortune reward the bold, but the unwary find only an anonymous death.

• Fast character creation to get you into the game quickly, including a lifetime of possibilities with an expanded origin path system.
• Dynamic rules for all eventualities that let you handle everything from social interaction to deadly fast-paced combat, starships and psychic powers to a system of profit and influence.
• Comprehensive background on Rogue Traders, written by Warhammer 40,000 novelist and GW Design Studio member Andy Hoare.
• Build your own starship or begin play with one of the six pre-generated vessels.

Begin your players’ path to wealth and glory with a complete starting adventure that puts the Explorers right into the middle of the action. The Rogue Trader core rulebook contains everything you need to start your adventure in the Warhammer 40,000 universe.
rpgissuearticle: Hammerschläge - was gibt's Neues im 41. Jahrtausend
rpgpodcastepisode: D6G Ep 41: Rush n Crush Detailed Review, Rogue Trader RPG Detailed Review, & Descent: Sea of Blood Interview
Dice of Doom Podcast 043: Rogue Trader Review, Pandemic and Splitting the Party

50986.name: Rune (Issue 31 - Winter 2008/2009)
50986.description:
User Summary:

This issue includes information on the four large events for 2009: the Spring Moot, the Great Erdrejan Fayre, the Summer Moot, and the Gathering.

Rules updates:

Clarification on the safe use of large weapons (weapons that are 42" to 72" in length and are wielded with two hands).

50987.name: The Witchfire Trilogy Collected Edition
50987.description:
From the back of the book:

The Witchfire Trilogy Collected Edition brings together the original award-winning trilogy of The Longest Night, Shadow of the Exile, and The Legion of Lost Souls, updates them to the 3.5 revision rules, and includes 2 bridge adventures to keep players adventuring in and around Corvis, the City of Ghosts.

50988.name: The Book of Drastic Resolutions: Darkness
rpgissuearticle: By All the Gods of Hell: Excerpts from the Gloranthan Encyclopedia, a work in progress
Dancing in the Shadows: Trolls and Spirit Magic
Dark Eater: Lord of Shades and Slavery
Herka’s Children: The Uz of the Elder Wilds
Never Light: Report of an Argan Argar Caravan
Notes on the Cult of Argan Argar
Notes on the Cults of the Blue Moon
Return to Skyfall Lake: The Journal of Ubiquus the Skeptic
Rodin in the Land of the Dark Elves
Shaping the Darkness: The Ergnabs Clan Story
Stygian Sorcery: New Spells for Trolls and Other Things That Love Night
Tales of the Night Hag: Bedtime Stories for Young Trolls
The Book of Drastic Resolutions: The Cult of Kyger Litor
The Face of the Enemy: Fire Gods among the Uz
The Fifth Tribe: The Culture of the Morocanth
The Land Where the Shadows Dance
The Order and Pattern of Darkness
The Twin Shadows: Notes on the Cults of Xiola Umbar and Zorak Zoran
A Treasury of Darkness: Troll Plunder
What Else Is There to Do Around Here?: Further Adventures in the Troll Realms
Who You Gonna Call?: Consulting the Troll Experts
Xarkarsh and Aksena: The Uz of the Six Mountains
Zugorteg: Goddess of the Dark Earths
“I Hate Trolls”, from “The Tale of Saralos Deguys”, a work in progress
50988.description:
A fanzine companion publication covering the Uz (Trolls) in Glorantha. Some of the material is drawn from material left out or cut from existing publications. Provides rich material on many aspects of the game world. An Issaries, Inc approved product.

Back Cover:
Welcome to the Book of Drastic Resolutions, yet another fanzine dedicated to the world of Glorantha. Inside you will find five cults and fifteen cult outlines, plus notes on eight published cults. Articles on the geography, culture, philosophy, and mythology of several Uz lands are supplemented by stats for seven NPCs, twenty-five creatures, eighteen magical plunder items, and over seventy-five new spells and skills, most of which have never been published before. Short fiction, information on the morocanth, and several excerpts from The Gloranthan Encyclopedia by Greg Stafford round out the contents of this book. A must have for anyone who loves (or hates) trolls.

50989.name: HârnPlayer
50989.description:
Subtitle: A Player's Guide to HârnWorld

A mechanics-free overview of the Hârn setting, intended as a quick reference for players.

From the Introduction:
HârnPlayer is comprised of three parts. The first part, Hârnview, is an overview of the geography, politics, economics, law, religion, and history of Hârn. The second part is a Book of Common Knowledge, which covers the Hârnic legends and folklore known to most folk. the third part is a players' Hârnic Dictionary,l a comprehensive alphabetical reference which players can use to look things up on an ongoing basis.

The information provided is more than a typical player probably would know, but nothing that one should not know. No matter how much reading is done, players will still be ignorant of much that a medieval person would take for granted. A bit of extra knowledge of the world compensates in a small way and makes the game more interesting.

50990.name: Castles of Harn
50990.description:
From the back of the book:

All eight sites in Castles of Harn include a colour local map, interior plans of each castle, and a key to buildings and other special features in each settlement.

50991.name: Different Worlds (Issue 32 - Jan 1984)
rpgissuearticle: Adventure by Design - Adapting Published Fantasy Role-playing Materials for Your Own Campaign
Books & Gaming - The Wizard and the Warlord
Game Reviews - Merc & Merc Supplement 1: In Country
The Gamer - My Favorite Game Store
The Kabbalah and Fantasy Role-Playing Games
50991.description:
Ancient Cultures Special Issue

Cover illustration: Brad W. Foster

50992.name: Armies of the Night
50992.description:
From the back cover:

Set in New York City two years after the nukes fell the players are tasked with restoring New York to government control.

Includes:

Map of New York with damage done during the war

Map showing the districts and major streets

Details of various organizations, marauder gangs, and petty warlords fighting over the city.

Background on the city including a fortune in gold lost in the city and other aspects of life in New York after the war.

50993.name: Men & Monsters
50993.description:
From the publisher's website:

The first supplement ever published for M&M. It described three new classes (Hunter, Thief and Centaur), presented a few extra rules and several new creatures, including Acteons and Automatons.

50994.name: Myth & Magic
50994.description:
From the publisher's website:

The second supplement, describing four new magic-using classes (Elementalist, Shapeshifter, Lyrist and Oracle) along with their specific brands of magic and a host of new mythic items, including several unique artefacts.

50995.description:
The Toast of the Town is the fifth game in the Pocket Battle Games series from LPS, Inc.

The game simulates the revolt of Boudica and uses the usual PBG card-drawing activation system. The Roman player wins if he can evacuate enough citizens from Londinium before the end of turn 6.

The Toast of the Town by Paul Rohrbaugh was offered as a "Jubilee free game", celebrating that (as of May 21, 2009) fifty-thousand copies of Against the Odds Magazine had been shipped.
50995.name: The Toast of the Town

50996.name: The Shadow Court
50996.description:
From the back of the book:

The Secrets of Winter

Tear aside the veil and learn the sinister secrets of the Shadow Court. Discover their dark rites and forbidden Arts. But beware - the Unseelie do not take kindly to those who pry into their affairs.

The Shadow Court is a complete guide to the Unseelie for both players and Storytellers. This book offers a wealth of information - from playing Unseelie characters to running Unseelie chronicles. It offers everything from new Arts, kith and noble houses to secret societies, Unseelie festivals and customs.

The Shadow Court includes:


Three new Unseelie Houses of the sidhe.



New Arts for Unseelie characters.



A wealth of information on the history and culture of the Unseelie Court and the more sinister Shadow Court.

50997.name: Hekatoteratos
50997.description:
From the foreword:

When the Mazes & Minotaurs roleplaying game first came up in 1972 (gee ! Is that ten years already ?), it included a selection of 92 folks, monsters, beasts, spirits and animates… then came Men & Monsters, which added 21 new beings (including the Tragic Floating Head, my all-time personal favorite) to the Maziverse. Then, over the years, dozens – no, myriads - of new creatures appeared in various adventure modules as well as in the ever-popular Creatures Compendium column of Griffin magazine.

The book you are holding in your hands compiles the very best of these contributions, along with a hefty dose of never-published-before material, for a grand total of exactly 100 creatures, hence the title. Hekatowhat, you ask ? Well, for those who (like me) never really got into Ancient Greek, Hekatoteratos apparently means something like « the book of 100 monsters » - and it was definitely a more stylish than our other ideas for a title, such as the very dull « Manual of Monsters » (my own suggestion), the somewhat pompous « Mythic Bestiary » or the improbable « Monstropaedia » (yes, Dave, that was your idea).

Rather than being presented as an A-Z list of 100 creatures, this astonishing assembly of dreadful denizens and bizarre beings has been divided into ten sections, with ten entries in each section.

50998.name: Capitán Alatriste: Juego de Rol
50998.description:
From the back cover of the book

No era el hombre más honesto ni el más piadoso, pero era un hombre valiente... con esas palabras los aficionados a las novelas de aventuras fueron presentados al capitán Alatrsite en noviembre de 1996. Arturo Pérez-Reverte iniciaba así las andanzas del personaje de ficción más popular de España entre los amantes del género de capa y espada, y de los buenos libros en general.
Este reglamento recoge en sus páginas toda la emoción, las intrigas y el peligro que el lector sintió al seguir las andanzas de Diego Alatriste en las novelas. Ahora, ese lector puede convertirse en un protagonista más de la historia y vivir sus propias aenturas en el Madrid del siglo XVII, en la corrupta y decadente España de Felipe IV. Desafiarás al destino echando mano del acero. Clavarás, de nuevo, una pica en Flandes. Beberás en la Taberna del Turco entre pendencias y botellas de vino. Conspirarás en los mentideros. Asistirás a los estrenos de Lope en el Corral del Príncipe. Conocerás a Góngora, a Quevedo, a Velázquez... ¿Quién sabe? Tal vez una noche serás emboscado en un callejón oscuro por unos jaques a sueldo de tus enemigos y de entre las sombras llegue la inesperada ayuda de la Ronda.
El juego de rol del Capitán Alatriste contiene todo lo necesario para jugar en el mundo creado por Arturo Pérez-Reverte. El libro incluye información sobre los protagonistas de las novelas: Alatriste, Íñigo de Balboa, Martín Saldaña, Alquézar, Malatesta, Angélica... También encontrarás una cronología completa de la época, una guía del habla de germanía, y una detallada descripción de los personajes históricos que hicieron de ese momento de nuestra historia algo épico y oscuro a la vez.
Bienvenido pues al Madrid de Alatriste. Coge papel y lápiz, y llama a tus amigos. Como diría don Francisco de Quevedo: No queda sino batirse.

50999.name: Comandos de Guerra
50999.description:
2nd Edition
From the back cover of the 2nd edition (in Spanish the original)

Se exigía a los Comandos que fueran aptos, que supieran nadar, que pudieran manejar cualquier vehículo de motor, pero la condición indispensable era que cualquier comando podía pedir regresar a su unidad cuando acabara la misión
Pocos tenían la oportunidad de hacerlo...

(in English)

It was demanded to the Commandos that they were fit, that they could swim, that they could use anykind of motor vehicle, but the essential condition was that any commando could return to his parent unit once the mission was over.
Few had the chance to do it

51000.name: Unveiled Addenda
51000.description:
From the title page:

The Legendary Games Studio creative staff had a hell of a time coming up with the title of this book… In fact, no less than twenty (twenty !) other titles had been considered before Alf Zyk suggested to call it Unveiled Addenda. Now, for the first time in gaming history, here is the complete list of those twenty titles that almost made it :

Unearthed Miscellanea - Forgotten Arcana - Exhumed Paraphernalia - Rules Supplement n°3
Book of Hidden Lore - Rules & Resources - The M&M Companion - Book of Many Things
Book of Bonus Bonanza - Advanced Addendum - Mythikal Manual - That Damn New Book
Son of Mazes & Minotaurs - Disinterred Marginalia - Excavated Incognita - Odds & Ends
Tome of Lost Knowledge - M&M Adventure Guide - Uncovered Extravaganza - Expanded Minotauria
